title: Putting Big Data to Work in Government: The Case of the United States Border Patrol
research_description: This study investigates how the United States Border Patrol (USBP) is adopting big data technologies for decision-making and field operations. It focuses on leadership involvement, field-level innovation, and challenges related to data integration and governance.
research_results: The study finds that USBP is in the early stages of big data adoption, with key innovations driven by front-line agents. Challenges include outdated IT infrastructure, cultural resistance, and limited data science expertise.
future_research: Future studies could examine similar adoption processes in other public sector agencies, particularly those in the security and defense sectors.
